results.definition: the person or thing chosen or selected
examples: he was my pick for mayor

results.definition: the quantity of a crop that is harvested
examples: he sent the first picking of berries to the market
it was the biggest peach pick in years

results.definition: the best people or things in a group
examples: the cream of England's young men were killed in the Great War

results.definition: the yarn woven across the warp yarn in weaving
a small thin device (of metal or plastic or ivory) used to pluck a stringed instrument
a thin sharp implement used for removing unwanted material
examples: he used a pick to clean the dirt out of the cracks

results.definition: a heavy iron tool with a wooden handle and a curved head that is pointed on both ends
examples: they used picks and sledges to break the rocks

results.definition: a basketball maneuver; obstructing an opponent with one's body
examples: he was called for setting an illegal pick

results.definition: the act of choosing or selecting
examples: your choice of colors was unfortunate
you can take your pick

results.definition: select carefully from a group
examples: She finally picked her successor
He picked his way carefully

results.definition: look for and gather
examples: pick mushrooms
pick flowers

results.definition: harass with constant criticism
examples: Don't always pick on your little brother

results.definition: provoke
examples: pick a fight or a quarrel

results.definition: remove in small bits
examples: pick meat from a bone

results.definition: remove unwanted substances from, such as feathers or pits
examples: Clean the turkey

results.definition: pilfer or rob
examples: pick pockets

results.definition: pay for something
examples: pick up the tab
pick up the burden of high-interest mortgages
foot the bill

results.definition: pull lightly but sharply with a plucking motion
examples: he plucked the strings of his mandolin

results.definition: attack with or as if with a pickaxe of ice or rocky ground, for example
examples: Pick open the ice

results.definition: hit lightly with a picking motion
eat intermittently; take small bites of
examples: He pieced at the sandwich all morning
She never eats a full meal--she just nibbles
